definition: one/1/single/a (article)/as soon as/entire/whole/all/throughout/"one" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 1)/also pr. [yao1] for greater clarity when spelling out numbers digit by digit
letter/symbol/character/word/CL:個|个[ge4]/courtesy or style name traditionally given to males aged 20 in dynastic China
one word worth a thousand in gold (idiom)/(in praise of a piece of writing or calligraphy) each character is perfect/each word is highly valued
one who can correct a misread or misspelt character and thus be your master
to not mention a single word (about sth) (idiom)
see 一字不漏[yi1 zi4 bu4 lou4]
headband/strip of cloth worn around the head
dispensing praise or blame with a single word (idiom)/concise and powerful style

sentences.english: An illiterate, later he received someschooling.
sentences.chinese: 他原来一字不识，后来学了一点文化。

sentences.english: The Material Interest merely looked in the other's eyes without saying anything.
sentences.chinese: 物质利益不吐一字，只是盯着对方的眼睛。

sentences.english: So you tap "agree" without reading a word.
sentences.chinese: 于是你未读一字便点击“同意”。

sentences.english: MPCA participates in every international film market around the word.
sentences.chinese: MPCA参加了身边的每一字国际电影市场。

sentences.english: He made a speech straight off the reel without stumbling over a word.
sentences.chinese: 他口若悬河，一字不顿地发表了了演讲。

sentences.english: I'll pray a thousand prayers for thy death but no word to save thee.
sentences.chinese: 我要千遍祷告让你死，也不祈求一字救你命。

sentences.english: We have not said a word to Lupin, but mean to keep it as a surprise.
sentences.chinese: 这件事我们对卢宾一字未提，想给他一次惊喜。

sentences.english: "Mooring" is one of the methods to be adopted when a ship isanchoring in the narrow waters.
sentences.chinese: “一字锚”是船舶在狭窄水域中所用的一种锚泊方式。

sentences.english: A:How can you recite such a long poem without even one mistake?
sentences.chinese: 你是怎么一字不错地背诵这首长诗的呢？

sentences.english: Is this "Lv-Shih Chun-Chiu" really that perfect until not a character can be change?
sentences.chinese: 《吕氏春秋》真的完美到增减一字都不行吗？

sentences.english: Side view of square head bolt with adjustable thread length.
sentences.chinese: 螺纹长度可调整的平头一字槽螺钉的侧面图。

sentences.english: A language with me a word clearly in whispers.
sentences.chinese: 同我一字一语的温润细语。
格伦的演讲词说得一字不误。

sentences.english: Thousand Years, the 100 deposit, but no word is not Muslim.
sentences.chinese: 千载后，百篇存，更无一字不清真。

sentences.english: I said nothing about it, because of his wife's being there .
sentences.chinese: 因为他妻子在那儿，我对此事一字未提。
他有个一字真言，“可扩展的”。

definition: letter/symbol/character/word/CL:個|个[ge4]/courtesy or style name traditionally given to males aged 20 in dynastic China
pausing at the end of a phrase or sentence (in former times, before punctuation marks were used)/punctuation/periods and commas/sentences and phrases
mnemonic chant/rhyme for remembering (arithmetic tables, character stroke order etc)
to cut short/extinct/to disappear/to vanish/absolutely/by no means
true statement/incantation (translates Sanskrit: dharani 陀羅尼|陀罗尼)
to pause at appropriate points in reading aloud unpunctuated writing/to punctuate
antithesis (two lines of poetry matching in sense and sound)/to fight/to wage war
